intro: Glandularia chiricahensis, commonly known as the Chiricahua glandularia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red.
